content.rendered:
Salesforce Ohana Slack AKA #OhanaSlack is a Slack Workspace that’s available to connect with theSalesforce community and get real time help 24/7.

Not so long ago (2017) in a galaxy not so far away in a place called Milwaukee there was a team – Kevin ‘Kevie Kev’ Mikolajczak and Meighan Brodkey. We were looking for a way to ask questions with the #SalesforceOhana – a way to have real time interaction with people. A place where people can go and have a zone to hang out and answer questions related to their specialty, and where when you need an answer to something you don’t know, you can easily find and expert to answer your question. The place we created was #OhanaSlack. Here we made a space for real time help, a place to hang, channels to vent like #whyadminsdrink, and a fun place to connect.

So what exactly is it and who is it for? Well, that’s easy… #OhanaSlack is for everyone in the Community, we have admins, devs, architects, specialist, and MVPs from around the world on at all hours of the day. There are channels for Communities, Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Files, Chatter, and more, and users are available to help you when you have questions.

There is Twitter, but it’s hard getting capped on your number of characters when trying to get help with an issue that you have. Yes, there is the Trailblazer Community, and it’s an awesome resource, but this is just another option to get help quickly there, since many of us are on slack any way for work, and we can chat in real time, so why not add another way to work together. It’s not here to replace anything, it’s just another way to connect with

The OhanaSlack Rules

Here’s the gist:

It’s great to have new members & we want to keep growing, to do that we need to be respectful of each other. Things are pretty basic.

On Terms

  1. Use channels for your questions, try to stay in a channel to match the topic you want.
  2. Only use general if you serched for a channel and none match.
  3. Use threads to respond to questions and comments to keep things clean.
  4. No spamming, questions can go in one place per posting, you should post multiple channels immediately for your question with the same text.
  5. No spamming via DM either.
  6. No selling! This is not Amazon, this is not the eBay, don’t sell stuff. We want a safe space – we love Partners and their products, if we ask about them ok, sure, but don’t market them here.
  7. Have fun, this is a space for connecting with Ohana and getting help

On Respect

  1. No unsolicited DMs for jobs or products or weird things. Saying hi, offering to help, questions, connecting are all good, but stay professional, and if asked to stop, stop.
  2. Be polite, no being rude, sexist, genderist, racist, any other -ist or put others down in anyway regarding them or what they need help with.
  3. No job stuff outside of the freelance and careers channels – this is not LinkedIn 2.0. and have fun, this is a space for connecting with Ohana and getting help.
  4. Your 2nd spamming warning is a boot from the space. Contact me with any concerns or needs.
  5. You agree that you will NOT collect, use, scrape, or anything of the such of users, and, you will NOT contact members for Sales lists/Marketing lists. Only opt in by members now allowed for any member contacting another externally. If you are found to be using OhanaSlack to create lists for selling/marketing without permission of the recipient, you will be removed IMMEDIATELY.
  6. Be respectful of each other and treat others as you want to be treated.

So be nice to each other, use threads, don’t sell, and don’t spam – outside of that there’s a laidback atmosphere where you can ask questions, help others, learn, and connect.

Join OhanaSlack Now

Why Use OhanaSlack?

OhanaSlack is not a replacement for anything out there, but just another tool to connect. You can get real time help vs waiting for someone to respond on a board, leading to interactive conversations and troubleshooting with members from around the world! It’s easy to access, just sign into Slack, and you’ll have it on your laptop, phone, etc. Plus, there’s great content for help, connections, careers, and just hanging out!

With the variety of channels for different parts of the platform, finding a place for you to hang with others in your speciality and find help from experts is easy! Just go to the channel for your question and you’ll have a whole team there who can help!

If you’re looking for a new role, that is held in the #careers and #freelance channels, keeping recruiting from the areas for questions.

Who’s on There

OhanaSlack has members from around the world. In fact, we have over 1000 members all over the globe. Recently a world map was started for each of us to pin our locations. You can see from the map, even though not everyone has pinned the map, we are all over the place!

The workspace has Admins, Developers, Architects, Partners, and even members from the Mothership! So many people with different skill sets and backgrounds – it really helps make it easier to find someone with an answer to your question.

How to Sign up

Just click here and signup with your personal email address. That way you keep access as you move along your trail! Sign Up Here

Hope to see you there soon!

excerpt.rendered: Salesforce #OhanaSlack is a Slack Workspace that’s available to connect with theSalesforce community and get real time help 24/7.

jetpack-related-posts.title: DF19 OhanaSlack Ice Cream Social
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Dreamforce 19 was amazing, wasn't it? So much fun seeing so many Ohana, all the awesome sessions, cool announcements, Obama!!! But this year at Dreamforce, I was able to do something a little extra special, and decided to try to bring some Ohana together myself. Knew before that planning things for…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce Events 2022
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: If you're interested in the Salesforce Events of 2022 find them here. Community, Partner, and Salesforce run all in one place!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce Events 2020
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The Salesforce Events 2020 is live!! That's right Ohana, it wouldn't be my blog if I wasn't talking about events and how we connect and get together as humans.  For real, we get out from behind the keyboard, and even leave the HOUSE!!! I know, it's crazy, but for Ohana,…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Slack Resources
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Interested in Slack? This is your opportunity to dive in! you'll find a Slack resources doc with ways to collaborate in this post.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Dreamforce 18 – The Thursday of Presentations
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: This Dreamforce was c-razy!! Not only was it my first Dreamforce as an MVP, but it was also the Dreamforce of back to back action for me. Here's a bit about my #DF18 adventure...

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce Events 2018
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Find out about the 2018 Salesforce Event, when they are and where. Link to the 2018 Salesforce events calendar and form for to submit updates and new events
